title: Understanding Conditional Formatting
text: Conditional formatting allows you to apply specific formatting to cells that meet certain criteria. This can help highlight important data or trends in your spreadsheet.

title: Locating Conditional Formatting
text: To start using conditional formatting, you need to locate the 'Conditional Formatting' option in your spreadsheet software. This is usually found under the 'Home' tab in the 'Styles' group.

hintAnswer: select the range, then click "Conditional Formatting" (home|styles), click "New Rule" in conditional formatting gallery, then "Format Style" (New Formatting Rule dialog box)
title: Steps to Apply Conditional Formatting
text: Follow these steps to apply conditional formatting to a range of cells.
choices: select the range, then click "Conditional Formatting" (home
styles), click "New Rule" in conditional formatting gallery, then "Format Style" (New Formatting Rule dialog box)
select a new style, Excel will automatically format your formatting
